articles.title: Idaho to send 250 inmates to Texas
articles.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — Officials with the Idaho Department of Correction say up to 250 male inmates will be moved to a correctional center in Texas due to a shortage of beds in Idaho's prisons and jails.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Idaho to send 250 inmates to Texas
articles.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — Officials with the Idaho Department of Correction say up to 250 male inmates will be moved to a correctional center in Texas due to a shortage of beds in Idaho’s prisons and jails. Director Henry Atencio said Thursday that he knows the mov…

articles.title: IDOC: Idaho inmates caused 'disruption' at Texas prison
articles.description: Idaho inmates housed in a Texas prison are accused of damaging two televisions, ripping apart a mattress and breaking several sprinkler heads.

articles.title: IDOC explains why up to 250 inmates will be transported to Texas
articles.description: IDOC Director Henry Atencio says the overall growth in Idaho has contributed to overcrowding and fewer and fewer available beds.

articles.author: nkorecki@politico.com (Natasha Korecki)
articles.title: Illinois governor profits off ICE detention center contracts
articles.description: Gov. Bruce Rauner says he relinquished investment decisions to a third party and has no direct ties to the company.

articles.title: Prison writing program allows inmates to find their voices
articles.description: TWIN FALLS, Idaho (AP) — "How the f— is this going to affect my life at all?"

articles.author: Jaclyn Gallucci
articles.title: Prison Operators Could Cash In on ‘Zero Tolerance’ Immigration Policy
articles.description: The biggest private prison operators, which have poured money into Republican coffers, stand to make a windfall.

articles.author: Rob Urban, Bill Allison
articles.title: Prison Operators Could Cash In on ‘Zero Tolerance’ Immigration Policy
articles.description: The biggest private prison operators, which have poured money into Republican coffers, stand to make a windfall from President Donald Trump’s “zero tolerance” policy on illegal immigration that has pushed thousands of undocumented immigrants into detention.
